title: Lamar Odom reveals he wants Khloe Kardashian back during bombshell first TV interview since near-fatal overdose
text:

Lamar Odom has revealed he wants ex-wife Khloe Kardashian back. 
The former NBA player spoke to Dr Travis Stork on The Doctors, in his first sit-down interview since his near-fatal overdose last year. 
Stork asks him what he is looking forward to now he has battled his demons, to which he says: "Honestly? I want my wife back." 
Meanwhile, when asked about his last memory before waking up in hospital, Lamar explains: "Being in that damn brothel and thinking I was going to just rest a little bit. 
"I wasn't in a good place mentally, especially mentally, before that incident happened.' 
"Me and my wife at the time were going through some things. I was in a dark place." Tears spring to Lamar's eyes as he talks about the night he could have died (Photo: The Doctors) 
The former NBA star woke up in hospital with then-wife Khloe by his side. 
Now that he's on the road to recovery, Lamar is trying to find some good in the horrible incident. 
He says: “I guess they say everything happens for a reason. I guess the reason is I’m here. I can tell the story.” Lamar Odom speaks to Dr Travis Stork (Photo: The Doctors) 
The overdose left Odom in a coma for several days. 
He tells of his horror at finding out what had happened when he woke up and saw his wife at his bedside. 
He says: “I didn’t know until Khloe told me that I was in a coma. 
"I couldn’t even speak at the time. I couldn’t talk. 
Nothing would come out of my mouth, so I was scared.” Lamar understandably gets emotional during the interview (Photo: The Doctors) 
Khloe originally filed for divorce from Odom in December 2013, but withdrew the papers to serve as his caretaker while he recuperated. 
The couple's divorce was finalised in October this year. 
The interview was conducted before the star checked himself into rehab earlier this week. Khloe and Lamar in happier times (Photo: Getty) 
It's since been reported that he did so in order to avoid temptation from drink and drugs on the 10th birthday of his late son. 
Jayden Odom was born on December 15 2005, to Lamar and Liza Morales - who also share Destiny, 18, and Lamar Jr, 14 - and died the following June at just six months old from sudden infant death syndrome (SIDS). 
According to TMZ.com, Lamar - who recently finalised his divorce with reality star Khloe Kardashian - "checked himself into rehab out of fear he'd go on a major bender as his deceased son's birthday approached". Like us on Facebook
